cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross Hispaniola and Cuba and then turn northwest into the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana or the TX/LA border area (near Port Arthur – Lake Charles corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-western Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (22% chance 34-kt, 8% chance 50-kt) late Wed into early Thu; gusty winds could exceed 40 mph if the core tracks near the TX/LA border.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If LAURA approaches as a strong tropical storm or hurricane, surge heights of 3–6 ft above ground level are plausible along Sabine Lake and adjacent coast, including Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands late Wed-Thu could bring localized totals over 4 inches producing flash-flood concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and hazardous seas/swell in approaches and channels beginning late Tue/Wed.
